content: This build is currently archived, meaning it's not maintained in the current season. You may continue to use and adjust it to your liking! While most Necromancer builds focus on a specific skill for the damage, all of the damage from this build comes from the that are cast from The scaling from this build has multiple sources.  One of the most valuable sources of scaling for both Offense and Defense is Maximum HP.  With the damage directly scaling from the % of Maximum HP you have.  Similar to other Bone builds, this also scales off of Intelligence and .  With the Key Passive and the innate scaling of is a great scaler and gains additional essence from the Legendary Node One key note, this build requires very specific gear and will struggle without fully investing into the requirements. It features the faction which hunts Realmwalkers, massive behemoths that roam outdoor zones and beckon Mephisto's hellspawn. Participate in these zone events and take down the Realmwalkers to spawn a portal to a Seething Realm. There you can acquire Seething Opals, new consumables that stack with Elixirs for a XP buff and the chance to gather extra rewards when defeating enemies. The types of Opals are: Use these Opals at all times to earn reputation with the faction and unlock further rewards. impacting your Book of the Dead selections, these become a massive increase in your overall damage output. Use the slider to see the progression steps. At around Paragon 200, leveling slows down significantly and all important nodes and Glyph sockets should be unlocked. Afterwards, you can min/max your build with minor tweaks and by picking up additional smaller nodes. Some Glyph position swaps, board changes and other pathing adjustments may occur as you unlock your full potential. Socket them in Two-Handed Weapons if your build calls for them, otherwise place them into your Armor pieces to replace normal gems. The affix slots that are typically used for Maximum Essence in builds, have priority to more important stats for both damage and survivability such as Maximum Life on your Focus. With the new temper of Bone Spirit has a chance to deal Double Damage, the increase in Maximum Life does not double your damage. Other than going slower and paying more attention to threats around you, there are some imporant things to consider: This is heavily gear specific.  You must have your Ultimate Cooldown tempers and at minimum a 2.3 .  While this offers a substantial increase in damage, the build still pilots better with due to the massive Cooldown Reduction. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) effects and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss will temporarily take less Stagger Damage from a CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regen is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again unless you bring a serious amount of crowd controls. The Spirit Wave Necromancer fills your entire screen with blood and bones.  Dealing incredible amounts of AOE and Single Target damage.  This build will take you to the highest levels of content and perform exceptionally well in both single and group play.
